intro: Scyphosyce manniana, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Scyphosyce manniana is often found in moist soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
